page.title: 01AINSDALE
page.content: AINSDALE IS A RESIDENTIAL AREA AT THE SOUTHERN END OF SOUTHPORT. IT MAINLY CONSISTS OF NEWER HOUSING ESTATES, MAINLY PRIVATE, BUILT AROUND THE ROAD AND RAIL LINKS BETWEEN SOUTPORT AND LIVERPOOL. BETWEEN THE VILLAGE AND THE SEA IS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SAND DUNES AND WOODLAND, MUCH OF WHICH IS A NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE. NEXT TO THE BEACH IS A PONTIN'S HOLIDAY CAMP. THE POPULATION OF AINSDALE WAS 15,789 IN 1981, A RISE OF 20.2% SINCE 1971. MOST PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED IN THE SERVICE SECTOR AND MANY HAVE TO TRAVEL INTO LIVERPOOL TO WORK.
